title: My computer won't run league (launcher too big resolution)
body:
For a brief time I was playing on a 720p TV and after plugging in my 4k monitor the game resized to a resolution my computer doesn't even support (so big) and it's unplayable. IT won't let me change the window settings or window size at all. Any help? It worked for a second when I plugged in the TV and unplugged it back to the monitor but then it happened again when I tried to actually play a game.

Tried to change the resolution in game-files (width/height). Didn't work.
Tried to run as admin. Didn't work
Tried to disable 640x480 checkbox when you right-click the LoL icon on desktop and go to properties...
Tried to also uninstall and reinstall everything, making sure I deleted any LoL files. No dice..

Tried so much stuff. Updated drivers, etc. No dice. Any help? My computer is good it runs everything else fine and I have a GTX 1080.

Thanks

replies.body:
You might be able to reduce the scaling of your client by holding Ctrl and tapping the minus key.  If this doesn't work, see if a config reset can restore your resolution to default:

Log into the game client.
Navigate to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config
Delete the file  named **game.cfg** and **persistedsettings.json**
Go into a custom game and verify that settings have saved properly.  Leave game to sync settings.
